title: How to Subscribe to and Read RSS Feeds with Internet Explorer

steps.headline: Ensure that you've selected to view the Command toolbar.
steps.description: The Command toolbar will display a button on Internet 7, 8, and 9 and any upcoming versions for any RSS feed that is detected on a webpage. Right click any place in the open portion near the tabs area of your browser. Click "Command bar", if you notice the item not having a checkmark to left of the item name.

steps.headline: Browse through your web pages you visit and commonly look for the orange new light button to become visible.
Click the drop-down button that is visible now, to select this option.
Select the RSS feed's name, the browser saw.
Look for the top orange bar at the top of the white portion of the webpage.
steps.description: This is the bar that will give you the option to save your feed for later viewing.

steps.headline: Click "Subscribe to this feed" button.
steps.description: It will then ask you to confirm your subscription activity.

steps.headline: Wait a few moments for the new orange bar (confirming a successful addition to the "Common Feeds" list.

tyn: RSS feed to subscribe to and read
text: Open Internet Explorer.  Ensure that you've selected to view the Command toolbar. The Command toolbar will display a button on Internet 7, 8, and 9 and any upcoming versions for any RSS feed that is detected on a webpage. Right click any place in the open portion near the tabs area of your browser. Click "Command bar", if you notice the item not having a checkmark to left of the item name. Browse through your web pages you visit and commonly look for the orange new light button to become visible.  Click the drop-down button that is visible now, to select this option.  Select the RSS feed's name, the browser saw.  Look for the top orange bar at the top of the white portion of the webpage. This is the bar that will give you the option to save your feed for later viewing. Click "Subscribe to this feed" button. It will then ask you to confirm your subscription activity. Click the "Subscribe" button.  Wait a few moments for the new orange bar (confirming a successful addition to the "Common Feeds" list.
sentences: Ensure that you've selected to view the Command toolbar.
The Command toolbar will display a button on Internet 7, 8, and 9 and any upcoming versions for any RSS feed that is detected on a webpage.
Right click any place in the open portion near the tabs area of your browser.
Click "Command bar", if you notice the item not having a checkmark to left of the item name.
Browse through your web pages you visit and commonly look for the orange new light button to become visible.
Click the drop-down button that is visible now, to select this option.
Select the RSS feed's name, the browser saw.
Look for the top orange bar at the top of the white portion of the webpage.
This is the bar that will give you the option to save your feed for later viewing.
It will then ask you to confirm your subscription activity.
Wait a few moments for the new orange bar (confirming a successful addition to the "Common Feeds" list.
